Article/0-0-0-18/full-stack-lifecycle.title: Full Stack Lifecycle
Article/0-0-0-18/full-stack-lifecycle.html:
Lifecycle methods are special named functions that you can declare in the class.<\/p>

Each lifecycle method runs in a specific order in a queue so it's guaranteed that all components initiated in that cycle will be prepared before the first one is initiated.<\/p>

Prepare<\/a><\/h2>

This method is blocking and runs before the first time the component is rendered.<\/p>

You can use this function to set the state that the user will see before things are loaded.<\/p>

If the user is entering from this route prepare<\/code> will run in the server before Nullstack server-side renders<\/a> your application.<\/p>

If the user is navigating from another route this method will run in the client.<\/p> 

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  prepare<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>date =<\/span> new<\/span> Date<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Initiate<\/a><\/h2>
This method can be async and runs right after the component is prepared and rendered for the first time.<\/p>

You can use this function to invoke another server function and load the data to present the page.<\/p>

If the user is entering from this route initiate<\/code> will run in the server.<\/p>

Nullstack will wait till the promise is resolved and then finally generate the HTML that will be served.<\/p>

If the user is navigating from another route this method will run in the client.<\/p>

After this method promise is fulfilled this.initiated<\/code> will be set to true<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>task =<\/span> await<\/span> getTaskByDay<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>
      day<\/span>:<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>date
    }<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>initiated)<\/span> return<\/span> false<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span> {<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>task.<\/span>description}<\/span> </<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ Learn more about server functions<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Launch<\/a><\/h2>
Runs before pre-rendering and at each awakening.<\/p>

You can update the component with things that doesn't require data fetching operations.<\/p>



âœ¨ Use this lifecycle to setup Meta tags.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  launch<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> page }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    page.<\/span>title =<\/span> 'Very good title that considers SEO'<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Hydrate<\/a><\/h2>
This method is async and will only run in the client.<\/p>

This method will always run no matter which environment started the component.<\/p>

This is a good place to trigger dependencies that manipulate the dom or can only run on the client-side.<\/p>

After this method promise is fulfilled this.hydrated<\/code> will be set to true<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  async<\/span> hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>timer =<\/span> setInterval<\/span>(<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> {<\/span>
      console.<\/span>log<\/span>(<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>date)<\/span>;<\/span>
    }<\/span>,<\/span> 1000<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>hydrated)<\/span> return<\/span> false<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span> timer id:<\/span> {<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>timer}<\/span> </<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Update<\/a><\/h2>
This method is async and will only run in the client.<\/p>

This method runs on every component anytime the application state changes.<\/p>



ðŸ”¥ Be careful not to cause infinite loopings when mutating state inside update<\/code>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

This will run right before rendering but will not block the rendering queue.<\/p>

The update<\/code> function will not start running until the application is rendered after the initiate<\/code>.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  async<\/span> update<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> today =<\/span> new<\/span> Date<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>today.<\/span>getDay<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> !=<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>date.<\/span>getDay<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
      this<\/span>.<\/span>date =<\/span> today;<\/span>
      await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>initiate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    }<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ Lifecycle methods have no special side effects, you can call them manually without causing problems.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Terminate<\/a><\/h2>
This method is async and will only run in the client.<\/p>

This method will run after your component leaves the DOM.<\/p>

This is the place to clean up whatever you set up in the hydrate<\/code> method.<\/p>

The instance will be garbage collected after the Promise<\/code> is resolved.<\/p>

After this method promise is fulfilled this.terminated<\/code> will be set to true which is useful in the case of persistent components<\/a><\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  async<\/span> terminate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    clearInterval<\/span>(<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>timer)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  executeBackgroundTask<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>terminated)<\/span> {<\/span>
      // ...<\/span>
    }<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>
